abstract: As if YouTube  did not have enough trouble with its users posting clips that violate copyrights, the video-sharing site, newly acquired by Google, must now find a way to remove a video depicting a Merrill Lynch banker and a supermodel in what the Associated Press calls “intimate scenes.” A Brazilian judge this week ordered YouTube to filter out the video, which was the talk of Brazil when it first surfaced last fall.
lead_paragraph: As if YouTube  did not have enough trouble with its users posting clips that violate copyrights, the video-sharing site, newly acquired by Google, must now find a way to remove a video depicting a Merrill Lynch banker and a supermodel in what the Associated Press calls “intimate scenes.” A Brazilian judge this week ordered YouTube to filter out the video, which was the talk of Brazil when it first surfaced last fall.

headline.main: Amorous Brazilian Banker Wins Round With YouTube
